intro: Suffrenia filiformis, commonly known as the threadleaf suffrutex, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its slender, thread-like leaves and small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its unique appearance and hardy nature, it is often cultivated in gardens with well-draining soil.
